meanings.definition: A ring or other device through which a rope runs to change its direction without chafing.
meanings.sent1: The fairleads on the ship guided the ropes smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The fairleads on the sailboat helped the ropes change direction easily.
meanings.sent3: The fairleads on the pirate ship seemed to have a mind of their own, always leading the ropes in the right direction.
meanings.sent4: The fairleads acted like traffic lights for the ropes, ensuring they moved in an orderly fashion.
meanings.sent5: The fairleads were like gentle hands, guiding the ropes along their path without any friction.

meanings.definition: A metal ring or thimble through which a rope runs to prevent chafing.
meanings.sent1: The fairleads were made of sturdy metal to protect the ropes from wear.
meanings.sent2: Sailors always checked the fairleads to ensure the ropes were safe from friction.
meanings.sent3: The fairleads were like little bodyguards for the ropes, shielding them from harm.
meanings.sent4: The fairleads were the ropes' best friends, always looking out for their well-being.
meanings.sent5: The fairleads were like armor for the ropes, keeping them safe from any rough edges.
